Home → New Chapters: Mental health information services → Links for your health and wellbeing

Links for your health and wellbeing

Here are some of the organisations and information sources available for a variety of mental health and wellbeing topics. If you are unable to find the information you need please feel free to contact us using the contact form.

Table of contents

  • Advocacy and mediation
  • Alcohol and drug dependency
  • Anger management
  • Anxiety
  • Ask for help
  • Bereavement
  • Bipolar disorder
  • Care act
  • Consultation
  • Counselling and online therapy
  • Dementia
  • Depression
  • Employment
  • Epilepsy
  • Hallucinations and voice hearing
  • Local organisations
  • Medication
  • Miscarriage and postnatal depression
  • Money & debt
  • National organisations
  • Personality disorder
  • Psychosis
  • Schizophrenia
  • Self–harm
  • Sexual health
  • Stress
  • Suicide prevention and family support

Advocacy and mediation

  • Ace Anglia - An independent Suffolk based advocacy service for people with learning disabilities
  • Feedback - Offers support to help express your views on mental health in Great Yarmouth and Waveney
  • Suffolk Family Carers - Support and advice for unpaid family carers in Suffolk
  • Suffolk User Forum - Operating through the east and west of Suffolk helping to shape the mental health services
  • Voiceability Total Voice Suffolk - Mental health advocacy service, including IMHA and IMCA services

Alcohol and drug dependency

  • Al-anon - National organisation with local groups offering support for family members affected by alcoholism
  • HOPE family support group - Ipswich based group providing information and support for family members and friends affected by alcoholism
  • Drinkaware - Hints and tips on managing alcohol intake and fact sheets
  • Focus 12 - Drug and alcohol rehabilitation charity based in Bury St Edmunds
  • Healthy Suffolk: Drug and alcohol treatment - Information and contact numbers for services across Suffolk
  • Mental Health Foundation: Alcohol and mental health - Fact sheet from national charity on the effects of drinking on your mental wellbeing
  • Mental Health Foundation: Substance abuse - Fact sheet on how substance misuse has a negative impact on your mental and physical wellbeing

Anger management

  • MIND (National) - Downloadable fact sheet from Mind on how to deal with anger
  • NHS Choices - Online video and hints and tips on how to on how to deal with anger

Anxiety

  • NHS Choices - Why do you feel anxious and panicky? Video and information to help
  • Rethink - What are anxiety disorders and how can they be treated
  • Mind (National) - Downloadable fact sheet on anxiety and panic attacks

Ask for help

  • NHS Choices - Your GP contact details and local NHS services can be found here
  • Suffolk Wellbeing service - for East and West Suffolk
  • Norfolk Wellbeing service - for Waveney and Norfolk
  • Samaritans - There for you 24 hours a day, 7 days a week

Bereavement

  • Cruse Bereavement Care - Offering support you need after losing someone you care about
  • Winston's Wish - Support for those who are caring for bereaved children
  • Age UK - Practical support and advice on bereavement
  • Survivors of those bereaved by suicide (SOBS) - National helpline and groups in Ipswich, Bury St Edmunds, Lowestoft and Norfolk

Bipolar disorder

  • Mental Health Foundation - Information on what Bipolar is and how it can be treated
  • Royal College of Psychiatrists - Printable leaflet on medications prescribed to help mood swings
  • BBC - Printable 24-page booklet on Bipolar with preface by Stephen Fry
  • Bipolar UK - Information from the National Bipolar Charity and find your local support group

Care Act

  • Care Act - Information on the new Care Act 2014 including an online video and an easy read version

Consultation

  • Health Watch Suffolk - Have your say about local health services in Suffolk

Counselling and online therapy

  • NHS Choices - The benefits of talking therapy explained
  • Counselling Directory - Suffolk based counsellors, contact details and what services they charge
  • Cruse bereavement care - Organisation to help with grief after the death of someone
  • Living Life to the Full - UK online based therapy
  • PTSD Resolution - Counselling for veterans and their families
  • Suffolk Mind - Healthy Minds counselling services information

Dementia

  • Age UK Suffolk - Provided to help those who live with or alongside people with dementia
  • Alzheimer's Society - What is dementia?

Depression

  • Rethink - Do you have depression or think you might have?
  • Royal College of Psychiatrists leaflets - Printable leaflet for those who have depression or if you are supporting someone with depression
  • Samaritans - Someone to talk to if you are troubled, available 24/7
  • NHS Choices: Postnatal Depression - Information and advice about postnatal depression

Employment

  • Job Centre Plus - How to contact your local JobCentre and benefits information
  • Realise Futures - Employment advisor details, with help from job searching to employment skills
  • Shaw Trust - Specialist help and support to find work
  • Papworth - Can help you find the job that’s right for you
  • Ultimate Guide to Building a CV - Step by step guide to writing a CV
  • How to Write a Resume - Includes checklist for CV essentials

Epilepsy

  • Epilepsy Society - National charity with practical information on the condition, helpline and medical ID cards/jewellery
  • NHS Choices - Further information on epilepsy and medication
  • Epilepsy Action Support Group - Support group for Suffolk

Hallucinations and voice hearing

  • Hearing voices network - An organisation committed to help people who hear voices
  • NHS Choices - Advice on hearing voices and hallucinations

Local organisations websites

  • Avenues East - Helping people with disabilities live fuller lives
  • British Red Cross Support at Home Service - Helping people stay at home after a short stay in hospital
  • Community Action Suffolk - Helping voluntary organisations across Suffolk
  • Inside Out Arts - Locally based organisation that helps recovery through art and full details on workshops and contacts
  • OneLife Suffolk - Valuable practical advice, guidance and courses to improve your physical wellbeing
  • Lofty Heights - Loft clearing and decluttering service in Suffolk to improve wellbeing
  • Norfolk and Suffolk Foundation NHS Trust - Find out about inpatient and community services
  • The Phoenix Project Club - Supportive group that meets in Ipswich with details on how to get in touch
  • Stepping Stones - Community support, decluttering services and much more
  • Suffolk Infolink - Community based database from Suffolk County Council
  • Suffolk Mind - Website for mental health charity with opportunities to improve mental wellbeing in Suffolk

Medication

  • NSFT pharmacy - When should I stop taking my meds? Find out about medication with downloadable information
  • Electronic Medicines Compendium (eMC) - Find out about medication

Miscarriage and postnatal

  • NHS Choices - Support and advice on the emotional impact of miscarriage
  • Child Bereavement UK - National charity that supports families through loss of a child including miscarriage .
  • NHS Choices - Information on how postnatal depression can affect you

Money & debt

  • Citizens' Advice Bureau - Advice for your day to day civic matters and find your local branch
  • Money Advice Service - Free impartial money advice
  • Gov.uk - A to Z of benefit entitlements
  • Ipswich Housing Association Group - Housing and money advice

National organisations

  • Mental Health Foundation - Hundreds of free downloadable resources and fact sheets
  • Mind - Advice and guidance from national charity with up to date campaign news and facts about living with mental ill health
  • Rethink - Information and guidance, local support groups and telephone support both locally and nationally
  • Samaritans - Available 24 hours, 7 days a week
  • Saneline - National campaigning charity, phone helpline (available 1800-2300), information and guidance

Personality disorder

  • Mental Health Foundation - Defines personality disorders and how they will affect you
  • Royal College of Psychiatrists - How does it feel to have a personality disorder? How many different types are there?
  • Suffolk Mind Waves Support Group - Local support group in the east and west of Suffolk

Psychosis

  • NHS Choices - Defines the main symptoms of psychosis
  • Rethink - Possible causes and treatments for psychosis

Schizophrenia

  • NHS Choices - What schizophrenia is and how it can be treated
  • Rethink - Information and telephone support with downloadable fact sheets
  • Sane - Downloadable fact sheet

Self-harm

  • Harmless - A user led support service for people who self-harm and for those affected by self-harm
  • Mind - Downloadable information on what self harm is
  • Sane - Free download for people who self-harm or if you are concerned about someone that does

Sexual health

  • Terrence Higgins Trust - Sexual health information, advice and support services including rapid HIV testing and long term condition management

Stress

  • Combat Stress - Mental health support for British armed forces veterans
  • NHS Choices - Defines post-traumatic stress disorder
  • NHS Choices - For those struggling with stress
  • Mind - Learn how to manage stress

Suicide prevention and family support

  • Norfolk and Suffolk NHS Foundation Trust - Telephone number and access to mental health services to direct you to the support you need
  • Samaritans - If something's troubling you, then get in touch. Available 24 hours a day, 365 days a year
  • Mental Health Foundation - Information and guidance regarding suicide prevention
  • CALM (Campaign Against Living Miserably) - Offering support to men in the UK, of any age, who are down or in crisis via a helpline and website
  • Survivors of Bereavement by Suicide - National helpline and local groups in Ipswich, Bury St Edmunds, Lowestoft and Norfolk that provide support for those affected by suicide
  • Norfolk and Suffolk NHS Foundation Trust (PDF) - Local suicide prevention strategy on providing care and support

About

My name is Sarah Lungley and I am the coordinator for Suffolk Libraries Mental Health and Wellbeing Information Service.

My role is to help provide information on local services and to promote events in our libraries and the community that can support mental health and wellbeing.

The service also aims to support our library staff, to ensure they are able to access useful and up-to-date information for our customers should they request it.

Libraries are a fantastic resource, not only for books and information but for community, friendships and fun too. So pop in to your local branch or explore our website to find out more about what we do – we hope to see you soon!
